str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From asthenes; feebleness; by implication, malady; morally, frailty.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The taking of an oath, an oath. From a compound of horkos and a derivative of omnuo; asseveration on oath.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From teleios; to complete, i.e. accomplish, or consummate.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
